To me it was a great watch but like someone before me said that the characters just died way too fast and that lead to a less impactful death. Also i know that technically Tatsumi isn't the MC but he defo got more screen time than Akame imo and the way he died was not really "satisfying" for me based on the fact that he was the "MC" (I'm talking no last speech, no wise last words or anything, just a sentence). This isn't my first anime so i wasn't expecting a happy end or anything XD but this ending really left a bad taste in my mouth, also the way they just carried on like almost nothing ever happened like none of their friends have died. (Also the way Esdeath just snatched Tatsumi with her was kinda wierd tbh) but yeah mostly because of the end for me this is a 7/10
It was 9/10 but Leone death was horrible her death was bad written so I give this 8/10.

8/10 loved it, the anime wasnt scared of killing characters off like *ehm* naruto *ehm* but the only issue with it is, 1 emperor is a total dumbass like holy shit like i can understand if he was just a dumbass but hes totally dumb like holy shit, 2 tatsumi never really got his own relic, like sure he got Bulat's and it evolved n stuff but it just doesnt give that unique thing if that makes sense, 3 wasnt Najenda supposed to die on the 3rd use of Su's ability? like dead dead not life span halved, and lastly MINE STOP SAYING UR RELICS ABILITY UR GONNA END UP BEING COUNTERED LIKE HOLY SHIT but wouldnt matter now since shes dead ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I totally disagree with your naruto comparison (Unless you're only counting the original Naruto anime and not Shipuden & Boruto), but hey, that's a personal opinion. But here, it seems like they thought "Hey, shows nowadays are too scared to kill off main characters" than that's all they did. IMO, it was a little overused for shock value and would have much preferred more development with certain characters so the deaths would have been more impactful, basically all I'm saying is that it gets too predictable after the first 3. The best example of building up a character/characters and having impactful death(s) would probably be from Assassination Classroom (Ansatsu Kyoushitsu) since all the characters are developed which leads to a truly impactful and emotional ending. (This isn't a spoiler as the first episode explains everything)

Tatsumi and Akame are both the Main Character, Tatsumi is for obvious reasons, he is the first one to show in this anime, he has more screentime, he has better writing (my opinion), and, he has a harem( on the other side ). But for Akame, she is, idk, doesnt feel like she is the MC all along. But imma say this, overall, id rate this anime a straight 8/10. But sadly, its a sad anime, deaths every time :(, but thats what makes this anime unique, unlike other anime that has plot armour every time, deaths in this anime goes unexpectedly which makes this anime so sad, the favorite characters just go poof, their dead. Anyways, I enjoyed it, but I might be depressed for quite a while :/. Tatsumi's dead was unexpected, it just happened instantly, specially how his body was taken away with Esdeath, which was her way of showing her love for him.
